Package.Name: MIMS.me.agriculture.6.0
Package.Description: Use for environmental and metagenome sequences. Organism must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'.
Package.TemplateHeader: # This is a submission template for batch deposit of 'MIMS: metagenome/environmental, agriculture; version 6.0' samples to the NCBI BioSample database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/). # Fields with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. Your submission will fail if any mandatory fields are not completed. If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing' as appropriate. # All other fields are optional. Leave optional fields empty if no information is available. # You can add any number of custom fields to fully describe your BioSamples, simply include them in the table. # CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates, incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to BioSample. # TO MAKE A SUBMISSION: # 1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application) # 2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)' # 3. Upload the file on the 'Attributes' tab of the BioSample Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/biosample/. # 4. If you have any questions, please contact us at biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: broad-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: Â mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]

Attribute.Name: local-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: Â shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]

Attribute.Name: environmental medium
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]

Attribute.Name: food source
Attribute.Description: Individual organism or category of organisms from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived, e.g., giant tiger prawn [FOODON:03412612]

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host common name
Attribute.Description: The natural language (non-taxonomic) name of the host organism, e.g., mouse

Attribute.Name: host height
Attribute.Description: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host length
Attribute.Description: the length of subject

Attribute.Name: host life stage
Attribute.Description: description of host life stage

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host, e.g. 9606

Attribute.Name: host total mass
Attribute.Description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass
Attribute.Description: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 Âµm. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.Description: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.Description: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: soil type
Attribute.Description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: soil type method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: storage conditions
Attribute.Description: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: environment adjacent to site
Attribute.Description: Description of the environmental system or features that are adjacent to the sampling site. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: agrochemical additions
Attribute.Description: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

Attribute.Name: ancestral data
Attribute.Description: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description, e.g., parental variety in case of mutant or selection, A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

Attribute.Name: animal water delivery method
Attribute.Description: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts terms listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: mean annual precipitation
Attribute.Description: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps

Attribute.Name: mean annual temperature
Attribute.Description: Mean annual temperature

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.Description: Free-living or from host (define relationship)

Attribute.Name: climate environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

Attribute.Name: collection method
Attribute.Description: Process used to collect the sample, e.g., bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)

Attribute.Name: crop rotation
Attribute.Description: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Attribute.Name: crop yield
Attribute.Description: Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land

Attribute.Name: culture isolation date
Attribute.Description: A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies, e.g., 5/24/2020

Attribute.Name: current land use
Attribute.Description: present state of sample site

Format.Description: cities | farmstead | industrial areas | roads/railroads | rock | sand | gravel | mudflats | salt flats | badlands | permanent snow or ice | saline seeps | mines/quarries | oil waste areas | small grains | row crops | vegetable crops | horticultural plants (e.g. tulips) | marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes) | tundra (mosses,lichens) | rangeland | pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing) | hayland | meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy) | shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus) | successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries) | shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts) | vine crops (grapes) | conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress) | hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen) | intermixed hardwood and conifers | tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms) | rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall) | swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants) | crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)
Format.Choice: rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)
swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)

Attribute.Name: current vegetation
Attribute.Description: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

Attribute.Name: current vegetation method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in vegetation classification

Attribute.Name: drainage classification
Attribute.Description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Format.Description: very poorly | poorly | somewhat poorly | moderately well | well | excessively drained

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

Attribute.Name: enrichment protocol
Attribute.Description: The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols

Attribute.Name: extreme event
Attribute.Description: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

Attribute.Name: FAO classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

Attribute.Name: farm equipment used
Attribute.Description: List of relevant equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season. This field encourages terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., combine harvester [AGRO:00000473]

Attribute.Name: farm equipment sanitization
Attribute.Description: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment including type and concentration of sanitizing solution and frequency of sanitization

Attribute.Name: equipment shared with other farms
Attribute.Description: List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms

Attribute.Name: farm watering water source
Attribute.Description: Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock, e.g., water well

Attribute.Name: fertilizer administration
Attribute.Description: Type of fertilizer or amendment added to the soil or water for the purpose of improving substrate health and quality for plant growth. This field encourages terms listed under agronomic fertilizer (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00002062). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order, e.g., fish emulsion [AGRO:00000082]

Attribute.Name: fire
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: Food harvesting process
Attribute.Description: A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism

Attribute.Name: food production characteristics
Attribute.Description: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef

Attribute.Name: food product type
Attribute.Description: A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field encourages terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, e.g., multi-component food product [FOODON:00002501]

Attribute.Name: food shipping transportation method
Attribute.Description: A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: food shipping transportation vehicle
Attribute.Description: A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: fungicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

Attribute.Name: gaseous environment
Attribute.Description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

Attribute.Name: genetic modification
Attribute.Description: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection

Attribute.Name: heavy metals method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: herbicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: horizon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the horizon

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: host dry mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of dry mass

Attribute.Name: host subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123

Attribute.Name: observed host symbionts
Attribute.Description: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host

Attribute.Name: humidity
Attribute.Description: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: isolation and growth condition
Attribute.Description: PMID or url for isolation and growth condition specifications

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: link to classification information
Attribute.Description: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

Attribute.Name: link to climate information
Attribute.Description: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: local classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local classification method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: lot number
Attribute.Description: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: negative control type
Attribute.Description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation, e.g., distilled water, phosphate buffer, empty collection device, empty collection tube, DNA-free PCR mix, sterile swab, sterile syringe

Attribute.Name: non mineral nutrient regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: Omics Observatory ID
Attribute.Description: A unique identifier of the omics-enabled observatory (or comparable time series) your data derives from. This identifier should be provided by the OMICON ontology; if you require a new identifier for your time series, contact the ontology's developers. Information is available here:Â https://github.com/GLOMICON/omicon. This field is only applicable to records which derive from an omics time-series or observatory.

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pesticide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

Attribute.Name: pH method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining pH

Attribute.Name: pH regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

Attribute.Name: photosynthetic activity
Attribute.Description: Measurement of photosythetic activity (i.e. leaf gas exchange / chlorophyll fluorescence emissions / reflectance / transpiration) Please also include the term method term detailing the method of activity measurement

Attribute.Name: photosynthetic activity method
Attribute.Description: Reference or method used in measurement of photosythetic activity

Attribute.Name: plant growth medium
Attribute.Description: Type of the media used for growing sampled plants, e.g., soil [ENVO:00001998]

Attribute.Name: plant product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: plant structure
Attribute.Description: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g., petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here

Attribute.Name: plant water delivery method
Attribute.Description: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field encourages terms listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., drip irrigation process [AGRO:00000056]

Attribute.Name: porosity
Attribute.Description: porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

Attribute.Name: positive control type
Attribute.Description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive

Attribute.Name: presence of pets, animals, or insects
Attribute.Description: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space, e.g., cat 10, dog 2, rodent 100, snake 1

Attribute.Name: previous land use
Attribute.Description: previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: previous land use method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: profile position
Attribute.Description: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.Description: Primary publication or genome report

Attribute.Name: relative location of sample
Attribute.Description: Location of sample to other parts of the farm, e.g. under crop plant, near irrigation ditch, from the dirt road, from air above crops, nearby river, e.g., furrow

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments, eg, aerobe, anaerobe, facultative, microaerophilic, microanaerobe, obligate aerobe, obligate anaerobe, missing, not applicable, not collected, not provided, restricted access

Format.Description: aerobe | anaerobe | facultative | microaerophilic | microanaerobe | obligate aerobe | obligate anaerobe | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: rooting medium carbon
Attribute.Description: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium, e.g., sucrose

Attribute.Name: rooting medium macronutrients
Attribute.Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S), e.g., KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

Attribute.Name: rooting medium pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium, e.g., 5.5

Attribute.Name: salt regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample collection method
Attribute.Description: The method employed for collecting the sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample pooling
Attribute.Description: Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g., RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: season
Attribute.Description: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729)

Attribute.Name: seasonal environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal humidity
Attribute.Description: Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal precipitation
Attribute.Description: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal temperature
Attribute.Description: Mean seasonal temperature

Attribute.Name: size fraction selected
Attribute.Description: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation, e.g., 0-0.22 micrometer

Attribute.Name: size-fraction lower threshold
Attribute.Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Attribute.Name: size-fraction upper threshold
Attribute.Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Attribute.Name: slope aspect
Attribute.Description: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315Â°. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

Attribute.Name: slope gradient
Attribute.Description: commonly called âslope.â The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.Name: soil conductivity
Attribute.Description: Conductivity of soil at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil cover
Attribute.Description: Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material

Attribute.Name: soil depth
Attribute.Description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g., for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples

Attribute.Name: soil horizon
Attribute.Description: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

Format.Description: O horizon | A horizon | E horizon | B horizon | C horizon | R layer | Permafrost

Attribute.Name: soil pH
Attribute.Description: The pH of soil at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil temperature
Attribute.Description: Temperature of soil at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil texture measurement
Attribute.Description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: soil texture method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.Name: solar irradiance
Attribute.Description: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.

Attribute.Name: spike-in microbial strain
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: standing water regimen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: tillage
Attribute.Description: note method(s) used for tilling

Format.Description: drill | cutting disc | ridge till | strip tillage | zonal tillage | chisel | tined | mouldboard | disc plough

Attribute.Name: total carbon
Attribute.Description: total carbon content

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen content method
Attribute.Description: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: total phosphorus
Attribute.Description: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

Attribute.Name: trophic level
Attribute.Description: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)

Format.Description: autotroph | carboxydotroph | chemoautotroph | chemoheterotroph | chemolithoautotroph | chemolithotroph | chemoorganoheterotroph | chemoorganotroph | chemosynthetic | chemotroph | copiotroph | diazotroph | facultative | heterotroph | lithoautotroph | lithoheterotroph | lithotroph | methanotroph | methylotroph | mixotroph | obligate | chemoautolithotroph | oligotroph | organoheterotroph | organotroph | photoautotroph | photoheterotroph | photolithoautotroph | photolithotroph | photosynthetic | phototroph

Attribute.Name: water pH
Attribute.Description: The pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid

Attribute.Name: water source shared
Attribute.Description: Other users sharing access to the same water source, e.g., multiple users, agricutural, multiple users, no sharing

Attribute.Name: water temperature regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: watering regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens
